timeline.bodyText: Do you happen to know if this is necessary also on Camel master? If not, a comment would be handy that it can be removed after Camel 3.1. Otherwise, a Camel issue would be nice requiring to fix what is necessary in Camel.
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: I have not checked. I assume it is fixed, but I can add a note. We could eventually remove this  on the camel-master branch.
replies.author: jamesnetherton

timeline.bodyText: I think this done by Quarkus Jackson extension. If that's really the case, we should perhaps prefer depending on them.
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: I'll double check, but I didn't see this being done by the Jackson extension.
replies.author: jamesnetherton
jamesnetherton

timeline.bodyText: Hm... why is this filter actually required?
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: Should the extension concern itself with configuring reflection for stuff that is not associated with it? E.g non-olingo stuff.
replies.author: jamesnetherton

replies.bodyText: OK, I see the problem. Hard to say, I am not acquainted well enough with olingo. Are the users likely to write their own deserializers to be able to use the olingo extension?
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText:
I don't think folks are going to want to write their own deserializers when interacting with the olingo component extension. So for now, I'd say it's safe to include the filter.
It will be simple enough to remove if we get feedback that proves that we don't need it.
replies.author: jamesnetherton
